entry.title: Soldiers' and Sailors' Arch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New York City's Soldiers' and Sailors' Arch (pictured) once had a puppet library?

entry.title: was once an Olympic sport (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that angling was once an Olympic sport?

entry.title: Doreen Lofthouse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the shape of Fisherman's Friend lozenges was based on the buttons on a dress worn by Doreen Lofthouse?

entry.title: RV Kaharoa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during an expedition on RV Kaharoa, a 34-centimetre-long (13 in) "supergiant" amphipod was discovered?

entry.title: Twice a Man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olympia Dukakis's first screen role was in the avant-garde film Twice a Man?

entry.title: Horton Davies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that ten years after publishing the book Great South African Christians, Horton Davies gave a speech criticizing South African churches and synagogues for their role in apartheid?

entry.title: Alabama croton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the two varieties of Alabama croton are separated by more than 1,000 kilometres (620 miles)?

entry.title: Tim Hughes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Aboriginal soldier Tim Hughes was decorated for remarkable bravery, exceptional coolness and initiative during the Battle of Buna–Gona?

entry.title: Victory Vertical (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Victory Vertical piano was developed in 1942 to be parachuted to US troops?
